311.01
 
 
905.01 PUBLIC UTILITIES; PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION; PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person, firm, association or corporation shall use any of the public
streets, alleys, avenues, boulevards or thoroughfares in the Municipality for
the purpose of maintaining upon, over and under the same any pipes or
pipelines, any wires, cables or conduits, or any other means of conveying and
transporting any water, natural gas, electric power or energy, or any electric
light or power service, or telephone or telegraph service, or motor vehicle or
taxicab for transporting passengers or freight, or for furnishing any public
utility service, without a franchise or permit therefor authorized by Council.
(Ord. 6-30-56)
905.02 MAINTENANCE OF SIDEWALKS.
   (a)   General Upkeep. All sidewalks in this Municipality shall be kept in
repair clean and free from dirt, snow and ice by the owners or occupants of the
adjacent property.
   (b)   Failure to Maintain. If the owner or occupant of any sidewalk, footway
or gutter, in the corporate limits of this Municipality or of the real property
next adjacent thereto, fails or refuses to curb, pave or keep clean, in the
manner or within the time required by Council, the Director of Public Works or
such other officer as Council may direct, with the advice of the Committee on
Streets and Alleys, shall cause the same to be done at the expense of the
Municipality and shall assess the amount of the expense upon such owner or
occupant, in the manner herein provided for the collection of Municipal taxes.
   (c)   Penalty for Failure to Maintain. The Director of Public Works or the
person making such repairs shall keep an accurate account of all expenses
incurred by him in making such repairs, and shall give it to the Street
Committee. If found correct by it the Committee shall report the same to
Council, who shall order an assessment upon such owner or occupant, who shall
pay the same.
(1941 Code 6-2-1 to 6-2-3)
905.03 PERMITS TO PLACE BUILDING MATERIAL IN STREETS.
   Any person desiring to place any building material in any of the streets,
sidewalks or alleys of the Municipality for the purpose of erecting a building
or repairing the same shall make an application in writing to the Director of
Public Works, setting forth what part of the street, alley or sidewalk is to be
used, and for what purpose and how long. If the Director finds that the
application is reasonable, and that the use is proper under the circumstances,
a written permit shall be given by the Director to the applicant to use the
street, alley or sidewalk, or adjacent thereto as set out in the written
permit, in the manner and for the period therein prescribed. Such written
permit shall not be of any effect or force until the applicant signs a contract
agreeing to make the street, alley or sidewalk so used in as good a condition
as it was before and to erect, at the applicant's expense, barriers by day and
lights and barriers by night, to prevent injuries to the public while such
obstruction is in the streets, alleys or sidewalks of the Municipality, and
agreeing to indemnify the Municipality for all damages that anyone injured by
reason of such use made by the applicant may recover against the Municipality.
   The Director shall cause all such applications to be numbered and filed and
a record kept of every such permit granted, numbered to agree with the
application; and the contract shall be numbered to agree with the application
and consent, and shall be filed.
905.04 DUTIES OF OFFICERS SEEING BUILDING MATERIAL IN STREETS.
   The Director of Public Works or any police officer seeing anyone placing any
building material in any street, alley or sidewalk shall immediately ascertain
whether the person has the authority to do so. The person so placing building
material in the street, alley or sidewalk shall show his authority for so doing
to the Director or the police officer when demanded. All persons without
authority for so using the streets shall be stopped by the Director or any
police officer.
905.05 PLACING BUILDING MATERIAL TO INTERFERE WITH ONE-WAY TRAFFIC.
   Nothing contained in these Codified Ordinances shall be construed to permit
any person to place any building or other material in any street or alley of
the Municipality in such a manner as to interfere with or prevent one-way
vehicular traffic.
905.06 REMOVAL OF DEBRIS BY BUILDING CONTRACTOR.
   Within ten days after the roof is placed upon any building, the contractor
or builder thereof shall cause the removal of all dirt, rubbish or material
remaining upon any street, avenue, alley or public place caused by or belonging
to any bricklayer or stonemason; and within ten days after the completion of
any building, the contractor or builder shall cause the removal of all other
dirt, rubbish or material caused by or belonging to any other mechanic or
person who may have been engaged in the construction of such building.
905.07 PERMIT FOR STORING CONSTRUCTION MACHINERY ON STREET.
   Machinery used in connection with the construction of buildings shall not be
stored or placed on any street, sidewalk or parkway if there is room therefor
upon the lot on which the building is being erected, or upon any adjoining lot
belonging to the same owner, without a permit from the Director of Public
Works. No person shall fail, neglect or refuse to comply with this section.
905.08 PLACEMENT OF GOODS AND MERCHANDISE UPON SIDEWALKS, STREETS AND ALLEYS.
   No person shall place upon the sidewalks, streets or alleys, any goods or
merchandise for the purpose of exposing them for sale, or for the purpose of
advertising or attracting the attention of the general public.
   Provided, however, that all property owners or their lessees shall have the
right to place their goods and merchandise, which shall mean all things
commonly sold in retail business establishments, immediately in front of their
respective businesses after complying with the provisions of this section.
Provided, however that in no case may a merchant's display occupy more than
fifty percent (50%) in length of the total front footage of his respective
business. Provided further, that no display shall operate to disrupt the free
flow of pedestrian traffic; block designated sidewalks as designated by the
Director of Public Works; or cause congestion of designated fire lanes as
designated by the City's Fire Chief.
   All property owners or their lessees who desire to make displays of their
goods and merchandise in front of their businesses shall first secure a permit
from the Mayor and furnish evidence of insurance coverage by submitting a
certificate of insurance naming the Municipality as an additional insured party
with a minimum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) property damage/three
hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) bodily injury; however, the Municipality
reserves the right to require greater insurance coverage depending upon the
type of display offered. In no case may the Mayor issue a permit until such is
approved by the Director of Public Works. There shall be no fee charged for
permits to merchants displaying in front of their own business.
905.09 DISTURBING BARRIERS ON CLOSED STREETS.
   When any street or alley in the Municipality has been closed for the purpose
of constructing, repairing, paving, sewering or otherwise improving it, no
unauthorized person shall take down or disturb any barriers that may have been
erected on any such streets or alleys.
905.10 SIGNS OBSTRUCTING STREET INTERSECTIONS.
   No portable sign, parasite sign or other device of such a nature as to
obstruct vision may be located within a fifty-foot triangular space at any
street intersection; it being understood that such triangular space shall be
determined by a diagonal line connecting two points measured fifty feet along
each of the projected street curblines, or approximation thereof, equidistant
from the projected and intersecting curblines at the street corner; it being
further understood that this section shall not include alley intersections.
905.11 OBSTRUCTING GUTTERS.
   No person shall obstruct or cause to be obstructed in any way whatever the
gutters of any street or public alley so as to prevent the free passage of
water along the same.
905.12 OBSTRUCTING DRAINAGE DITCHES.
   No person shall obstruct or cause to be obstructed, in any way whatsoever,
the drainage ditches of any street, avenue, road or alley or other public place
so as to prevent the free passage of water along the same. When it is found
that any such drainage ditch is obstructed so as to interfere with the drainage
of water, then the obstruction shall be immediately removed or altered as the
case may be by the person obstructing the same; and unless the same is so
removed or altered as the case may require, then the Municipality shall remove
or alter the same and the cost thereof shall be charged to the owner abutting
thereon.
905.13 WATER, GAS AND SEWER CONNECTIONS WHEN STREET IS TO BE PAVED.
   When any street, alley or public place of the Municipality is about to be
improved by paving, macadamizing or by any other method, the Director of Public
Works shall give ten days' notice thereof to the owners or the agents of the
owners of any lots or pieces of ground on which buildings have been erected on
the line of such street, alley or public place, or adjacent thereto, directing
them to make connection with the water and gas mains and public sewers, if any
exist and underlie the street, avenue, alley or public place, for the purpose
of conducting water or gas into the buildings or drawing the wastewater
therefrom. Such connections shall be made and completed within twenty days
after the giving of the notice. Upon the failure of the owner to comply with
such notice, the Municipality shall do the work and the expense thereof shall
be charged to such owner.
905.14 REPAIR OF RAILROAD TRACKS AND ADJACENT PAVING.
   Railroad companies shall make such repairs to their tracks which cross or
are located in public ways and the paving adjacent thereto as may be required
by the Director of Public Works, within thirty days of receipt of notice from
the Director.
905.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
101.99 for general Codified Ordinances penalty.)
   Whoever violates any provision of Section
905.01 shall be fined not less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more than
three hundred dollars ($300.00) and each day such violation continues without a
franchise or permit obtained from Council shall be treated as a separate
offense.
ARTICLE 907
Excavations
907.01   Permit required; exceptions.
907.02   Permit application.
907.03   Permit fees.
907.04   Payment of money due Municipality prerequisite to permit issuance.
907.05   Permit issuance.
907.06   Supervision and inspection of work; street repair.
907.07   Duties of officer observing excavating in or near streets.
907.08   Enforcement of article.
907.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate street excavations - see W.Va. Code 8-12-5(2)
Street obstructions - see TRAF.
311.01
Loads dropping or leaking - see TRAF.
347.04
Disturbing barriers - see S.U. & P.S.
905.09
 
 
907.01 PERMIT REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS.
   No person shall open the surface of any street, alley or way of the
Municipality or shall make an excavation so near the line of any street, alley
or sidewalk so as to endanger public travel, unless a permit is obtained for
that purpose in the manner described in this article; provided, that it shall
not be necessary for the corporate authorities of the Municipality to obtain a
permit or for any railway company to obtain a permit for the purpose of
repairing the roadbeds of its railway or the pavements between its tracks and
one foot outside thereof, where such railway company shall repair and keep in
repair that portion of the highway.
907.02 PERMIT APPLICATION.
   (a)   Any person desiring a permit required by Section
907.01 shall file with the Director of Public Works a written application for
each and every opening, which application shall be signed by the person
desiring such permit. Such application shall set forth the purpose for which
such opening or excavation is to be made, the extent, size and location of the
same and the dates during which such opening or excavation is to be permitted
and shall provide that the applicant will faithfully comply with each and every
provision contained in this article.
   (b)   Such application shall also specify the name of the owner of the
property served or to be served by the facility located in the street opening.
   (c)   The provisions of this section shall in no event apply to the repair
of a sidewalk by any adjoining property owner. The repair, opening or
excavation of any public sidewalk shall be governed by the provisions of
Article
909.
907.03 PERMIT FEES.
   The following permit fees are to be paid for the issuance of a street
opening permit: ten dollars ($10.00) and twenty-five cents ($.25) per square
foot of opening.
907.04 PAYMENT OF MONEY DUE MUNICIPALITY PREREQUISITE TO PERMIT ISSUANCE.
   No permit required by Section
907.01 shall be granted to any applicant therefor unless such applicant pays to
the Municipality all money then due to the Municipality from such applicant for
prior openings or excavations made or for any loss, damage or expense in any
manner occasioned by or arising from the opening or excavations under prior
permits issued to such applicant.
907.05 PERMIT ISSUANCE.
   A permit required by Section
907.01 shall be issued by the Director of Public Works when the person applying
for such permit complies with Sections
907.02 to
907.05.
907.06 SUPERVISION AND INSPECTION OF WORK; STREET REPAIR.
   All work done under the authority of any permit issued pursuant to this
article shall be supervised and inspected by the Director of Public Works. The
Director shall have the right to inspect all work done under any permit issued
pursuant to this article. All questions arising under any of the provisions of
this article as to the amount of work reasonably required to be done to insure
a permanent repair shall be determined by the Director, his agents or
employees, and such work shall at all times be under his supervision,
inspection and direction.
   In the event the opening is not closed to the satisfaction of the Director,
the Municipality may replace the surface in a satisfactory manner and charge
the costs to the person who obtained the permit.
907.07 DUTIES OF OFFICER OBSERVING EXCAVATING IN OR NEAR STREETS.
   The Director of Public Works or any police officer seeing anyone making any
excavation in the street, alley or sidewalk, or so near thereto as to endanger
the traveling public, shall immediately ascertain whether the person has the
authority to do so. The person so making an excavation in or near the street,
alley or sidewalk shall show his authority for so doing to the Director or the
police officer when demanded. All persons without authority for so excavating
shall be stopped by the policeman or the Director.
907.08 ENFORCEMENT OF ARTICLE.
   The Director of Public Works shall see that all the provisions of this
article are strictly enforced, and shall prosecute every person violating any
of the provisions of this article and shall bring suit to restrain any person
from opening the surface of any street or way of the Municipality in violation
of the provisions of this article, as well as any person making an excavation
near the line of any street, alley or sidewalk so as to endanger public travel.
907.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
101.99 for general Codified Ordinances penalties.)
ARTICLE 909
Curb to Property Line Improvements
909.01   Sidewalk repairs; permit; application; fee.
909.02   Permit fee.

909.06   Failure to comply with notice served; how work to be done; cost; lien.
909.07   Collection of assessments for work done by Municipality.
909.08   Supervision of work done.
909.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
General powers relative to curbs - see W. Va. Code 8-12-5(1) et seq.
Powers generally - see W. Va. Code 8-12-5(1) et seq.
Low cost improvements - see W. Va. Code Art. 8-17
Street assessment - see W. Va. Code Art. 8-18
 
 
909.01 SIDEWALK REPAIRS; PERMIT; APPLICATION; FEE.
   No persons shall make a repair, opening or excavation to any public sidewalk
for any purpose without first making application to the Director of Public
Works for a sidewalk repair permit. Such application shall specify the exact
location of the proposed repair and the adjoining property owners to be served
by such repair.
   Fees for sidewalk repair permits shall be paid in the amount specified in
Section
909.02 and in accordance with the procedure established in Section
909.02.
909.02 PERMIT FEE.
   The following permit fee is to be paid for the issuance of a permit required
by the provisions of this article: sidewalk repair permit: ten dollars
($10.00).
909.03 LOCATION AND CONSTRUCTION OF SIDEWALKS.
   All sidewalks in the Municipality shall be located as required by the
Director of Public Works and constructed in accordance with his specifications;
provided, that no sidewalk shall be constructed of asphaltic concrete. No
sidewalk shall set stakes and give grades for all sidewalks.
909.04 RESOLUTIONS REQUIRING PLANTING AND CARE OF SHADE TREES.
   Council may, by resolution, require the owners or occupiers of the land,
lots or parts of lots abutting or facing upon any street or alley in the
Municipality, to plant, replant and care for shade trees along such street or
alley, at such points, and in such manner as Council may determine by such
resolution and may require the owners or occupiers of such land, lots or parts
of lots facing or abutting upon such streets or alleys to keep the sidewalks
clean and in good repair, to grade the plot of ground on either side of the
sidewalk between the street curb and the property line, and to keep the same
sodded with grass and free from weeds and obstructions and otherwise in good
condition and repair, and may require such owners or occupiers of the land,
lots or parts of lots abutting or fronting upon such streets or alleys to keep
the same free from weeds and other vegetation which may be unsightly or
noxious. Twenty days' notice of the foregoing requirements served, as provided
by this article, shall be served upon the owners or occupiers of such land,
lots or parts of lots.
909.05 SERVICE OF NOTICE.
   Any notice to be served under the provisions of this article may be
delivered to the Chief of Police, who shall immediately execute the same by
delivering a copy thereof to the person named in such notice, if he is a
resident of the Municipality or if he is a nonresident within the Municipality,
and the officer executing such notice shall make his return on the original
notice, showing the time and the manner of such service, or notice may be given
to any such person by publication once each week for two consecutive weeks in a
newspaper of general circulation in the Municipality, or notice may be served
in any of the methods described by State law for service of notice and process.
909.06 FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH NOTICE SERVED; HOW WORK TO BE DONE; COST; LIEN.
   If the owners or occupants of any land, lots or parts of lots abutting or
fronting on any streets or alleys of the Municipality fail, within twenty days
after having been served with notice to do so, to put down a suitable curb of
concrete or other material along and for the footways and sidewalks of any of
the streets or alleys of the Municipality, or fail to lay, relay or repair any
sidewalks and gutters in, on or along any of such streets or alleys, or to
plant, replant and care for shade trees along any of such streets or alleys, at
such points, and in such manner as Council may have determined, or fail to keep
such sidewalks clean and in good repair, or to grade the plot of ground on
either side of such sidewalk between the street curb and property line, and to
keep the same sodded with grass and free from weeds and obstructions and
otherwise in good condition and repair, or to keep any land, lots or parts of
lots abutting or fronting upon any of the avenues, streets, roads or alleys of
the Municipality free from weeds and other vegetation, which may be unsightly
or noxious, such work may be done by the Municipality, or Council may let such
work to contract. In either case, the total cost of the work or such part
thereof, as Council may direct or determine, shall be charged and assessed upon
and against the land, lots or parts of lots abutting or fronting upon any of
such streets or alleys, which assessment shall be and remain a lien upon such
land, lots or parts of lots, the same as taxes levied upon real estate in the
Municipality, which may be enforced by a suit in equity before any court having
jurisdiction, as other liens against real estate are enforced, and shall also
be a debt against the owners or occupiers of such land, lots or parts of lots,
which may be collected as other debts are collected, in any court having
jurisdiction, and shall be due and payable in ninety days from the completion
and acceptance of such work as certified to by Council, with six percent (6%)
interest thereon from the date of such record acceptance, and in addition
thereto, such cost or expense, with interest at six percent (6%), may be
collected from the owner, occupant, tenant, agent or assignee, by distress or
sale in the same manner in which taxes levied against real estate are herein
authorized to be collected. The costs or expenses with interest thereon at six
percent (6%) for such work as may remain unpaid at the time of the making out
of tax tickets, covering the taxes due in any year by such owners of such lots
or lands, shall be placed on the tax tickets for that year along with the
statement of other taxes due by such owners, and the Director of Finance shall
collect such amounts at the time and in the manner as other Municipal taxes are
collected by him from such owner, without allowing any discount thereon, and
upon failure to pay the same on or before the last day of that year, there
shall be added thereto the same interest penalties as are provided for the
failure to pay other taxes assessed at such time against such owners. The
Director, upon the failure to pay such amounts, shall return the real estate,
against which such amount is a lien, delinquent for the nonpayment of taxes for
such year the same as in the case of returning such lands delinquent for the
nonpayment of other taxes assessed against such owner, and the real estate may
be sold, at the time and in the manner provided for in the case of delinquent
lands for the nonpayment of taxes.
   In ascertaining the amount to be assessed upon or against any corner lot for
the cost or expense of doing or causing to be done, any of the work herein
mentioned, Council may assess the total cost of such work in front or alongside
such lot and extended to the curb or gutter of the intersections of the streets
or alleys at that point.
909.07 COLLECTION OF ASSESSMENTS FOR WORK DONE BY MUNICIPALITY.
   When work is done by the Municipality under Section
909.06 and is not let to contract, Council shall certify such assessments to
the Director of Finance for collection, who shall account for the same in the
same manner as he accounts for Municipal taxes, and the Director shall accept
payment, when tendered, of the amount of such assessment with interest to the
date of payment, and unless the assessment is paid within ninety days from the
date of such assessment, then a copy of such report shall be certified by the
Village Recorder to the County Clerk, who shall record and index the same in
the proper trust deed book in the name of each person against whose property
assessments appear thereon. If any such assessment is not paid when due,
Council shall cause to be enforced the payment of such assessment and interest,
in all respects as herein provided, which such assessment shall be a lien on
the property liable therefor the same as taxes, and shall have priority over
all other liens except those for taxes due the State and the County, and shall
be on a parity with taxes or assessments due the Municipality. When such
assessment is paid in full, and a lien therefor is of record in the County
Clerk's office, the Director of Finance shall execute and deliver to the owner
of the property a release of the lien, which may be recorded in the office of
the County Clerk as other releases of lien are recorded.
909.08 SUPERVISION OF WORK DONE.
   All work done under Section
909.06 whether done by the Municipality direct or through contractors, shall be
under the supervision of the Director of Public Works.
909.99 PENALTY.
   If any person fails, neglects or refuses to put down a suitable curb of
concrete or other material along and for the footways and sidewalks of any of
the avenues, streets, roads or alleys of the Municipality, or to lay, relay or
repair any sidewalks and gutters in, on or along any of such streets or alleys,
or to plant, replant and care for shade trees along any of such streets or
alleys at the points and in the manner as Council may have determined, or fails
to keep such sidewalks clean and in good repair, or to grade the plot of ground
on either side of such sidewalks between the street curb and property line, and
to keep the same sodded with grass and free from weeds and obstructions and
otherwise in good condition and repair, or to keep any land, lots or parts of
lots abutting or fronting upon such streets or alleys of the Municipality free
from weeds and other vegetation which may be unsightly or noxious, within
twenty days after service of any notice to do so, as provided for in Section
909.04, such person shall be punished as provided in Section
101.99.
ARTICLE 915
Trees and Shrubs
915.01   Permit for planting in public place.
915.02   Trimming.
915.03   Planting in public places.
915.04   Power of Director of Public Works to trim or remove.
915.05   Injuring shade trees.
915.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see W. Va. Code 8-12-5(29)
Shade trees - see S.U. & P.S.
909.04
 
 
915.01 PERMIT FOR PLANTING IN PUBLIC PLACE.
   No person shall plant or set out any tree, shrub or vine, or cause,
authorize or procure any person to plant or set out any tree, shrub or vine in
or upon any part of any public street or public place, without first obtaining
from the Director of Public Works a written permit to do so and without
complying in all respects with such conditions as are set forth in such written
permit.
   All applications for the permits required by the provisions of this section
shall be made on blanks furnished by the Municipality and shall describe the
work to be done and shall state the variety, size and exact location of each
tree, shrub or vine. After the receipt of such an application, the Director
shall investigate the locality where the tree, shrub or vine is to be placed
and shall take into consideration, in considering the application, the normal
growth and development of such tree, shrub and vine. Each permit issued by the
Director shall specify the location, variety and size of each tree, shrub or
vine and method of planting, and shall be good only for the period stated
therein. There shall be no charge for such permits, but before any permit is
issued for planting more than ten trees, shrubs or vines, the Director may
request from the applicant a detailed declaration of intentions, either in the
form of a planting plan or a written statement containing such information as
the Director may require.
915.02 TRIMMING.
   Trees, vines, bushes, shrubbery or flowers standing in or upon any public
street or public place, or on any lot or land adjacent to any public street or
public place, and having branches, limbs, trunks or other parts projecting into
the public street or place shall, under the supervision of the Director of
Public Works, be kept trimmed by the owner or occupant of the adjoining
property so as not to interfere with the free and safe passage along such
public way by pedestrians and vehicular traffic.
915.03 PLANTING IN PUBLIC PLACES.
   The following regulations are hereby established for the planting of trees,
shrubs or vines in or upon the public streets and public places of the
Municipality:
   (a)   No tree shall be planted at the intersection of two or more streets or
within twenty feet of such intersection.
   (b)   No tree, shrub or vine shall be planted where the clear space between
the curb and the sidewalk is less than three feet.
   (c)   No tree, shrub or vine shall be planted nearer than two feet from the
curb line or outer line of the sidewalk.
915.04 POWER OF DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC WORKS TO TRIM OR REMOVE.
   The Director of Public Works shall have the right to trim or remove such
trees and shrubs within the lines of all streets, alleys, lands and public
grounds as may be necessary to insure safety to pedestrians and vehicular
traffic and he, under the power granted by this section, may remove, cause or
order to be removed any tree, shrub or part thereof, which is in an unsafe
condition or which, by reason of its location, may be hazardous to pedestrians
or vehicular traffic. The Director shall have the power to enter upon any
private grounds for the purpose of trimming or removing trees and shrubbery in
order to prevent danger therefrom to persons or property, in the event the
owner or occupant of such premises does not comply with the orders of the
Director relative to the trimming or removal of trees or shrubbery which, in
his opinion, is hazardous to pedestrians or vehicular traffic.
915.05 INJURING SHADE TREES.
   No persons shall cut, saw, tear or break down any ornamental or shade trees,
along the sidewalk or in any other public place in the Municipality or injure
the same in any manner.
915.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
101.99 for general Codified Ordinances penalty.)
